PHRASE.LANG: Once, long ago, letters were written by hand with ink and "paper." They were placed in "envelopes" and mailed via snails to their recipients.[#Legal]

Il était une fois une époque où l'on écrivait des lettres à l'encre sur du "papier". On les mettait dans des "enveloppes" que l'on déposait dans des boîtes jaunes pour que des escargots les envoient à leurs destinataires.[#Legal]
Vor langer Zeit wurden Briefe per Hand mit Tinte und "Papier" geschrieben. Man legte sie in "Umschläge" und verschickte sie per Schneckenpost an ihre Empfänger. [#Legal]
Una volta, molto tempo fa, le lettere si scrivevano con carta e inchiostro, poi venivano messe in buste e spedite ai destinatari tramite lentissime lumache.[#Legal]
Hace mucho tiempo, las cartas se escribían a mano con tinta y papel. Se metían en sobres y unos caracoles las llevaban al destinatario.[#Legal]
Once, long ago, letters were written by hand with ink and "paper." They were placed in "envelopes" and mailed via snails to their recipients.[#Legal]
오래 전, 이런 편지지와 잉크를 사용하여 편지를 쓰곤 했습니다. [#Legal]
Once, long ago, letters were written by hand with ink and "paper." They were placed in "envelopes" and mailed via snails to their recipients.[#Legal]
很久以前、信件曾經是用墨水和「紙張」手寫、然後放在「信封」裡、再經蝸牛郵件寄給收信人。[#Legal]
很久以前、信件曾經是用墨水和「紙張」手寫、然後放在「信封」裡、再經蝸牛郵件寄給收信人。[#Legal]
Once, long ago, letters were written by hand with ink and "paper." They were placed in "envelopes" and mailed via snails to their recipients.[#Legal]
